column4: Guy's this is my first time on a linux program and installing a second OS. Does anyone know how to make Ubuntu the default boot and remove WinXP entirely? because when I restart it will just go back to xp agian.. and I Have to install Ubuntu again
can you press ESC when you boot to get to the grub menu?
ok open up a terminal, applications > accessories > terminal
now, do you have only one hard drive?
ok, now type this: sudo fdisk /dev/hda
now enter x and then d, and read off the first 3 values on 0x000: (you may have to scroll up)

ok, that means grub isn't being used.  I am going to have the bot send you a guide on reinstalling grub.  If anything is unclear just come in here and ask the channel.  You want the ``restoring grub after installing windows'' link
ubotu seems to be sleeping, here is the link: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows
before you go, if you have problems, there is no need to reinstall ubuntu, just come in here from windows
when you type 'mount' does it say '/dev/hdaX on / type...' ?
are you using a livecd now?
but you did install ubuntu right?
ah, the livecd just loads ubuntu from the cdrom, it is a sort of preview.  What you want to download, is the install cd
you don't have ubuntu installed if you didn't use thte install cd
yes
where did you get the deb from?
you need java and once you get it you need to modify one of the files for the .deb
first you will have to change the current working directory to the Desktop, this command would do that: cd ~/Desktop
for some MS may be better, it depends on the individual
mp3?
what type of music files are they?
